title: MergePDF_V01
content:
When serval people are writing at the same time or an article needs different layout styles, it is necessary to merge the pdf file.

MergePDF_V01 is a simple MATLAB app to merge serval PDF files.

Demo

Figure 1　GUI layout
  • Step 1 Select input PDF files

Figure 2　Select input files

File names in the cell array are sorted in the order that the user’s platform uses

  • Step 2 Select output path and merge files

Figure 3　Merge PDF files

Download

You and download the codes at https://github.com/FE-Lucky-Rain/Tool

title: Welcome to ROTA!
content:
Welcome to the ROTA documentation site! ROTA is a opensource MATLAB tool for the simulation.

ROTA starts from mesh generation to component modelling, trying to connect control, engineering calculation, finite element analysis and multi-body analysis

title: Point2D
content:
Introduction

Point2D is an object responsible for importing and creating 2D point.

Examples

Add Points

You can add serval points using AddPoint.

Add points at polar coordinate:

Add points incrementally using ‘delta’:

Any time the points added to the Point2D object, will join a new group.

Compress points

If points repeated, you can use CompressNpts to delete repeated points.

Distance calculate

Dist is function to calculate the distance between a single point to several points.

The results are shown below.

Cheat sheet

Name Description Options
Point2D(‘Name’) Creat Line2D object
AddPoint(obj,x,y) Add points to Point2D ‘polar’, ‘delta’
Plot(obj,varargin) Plot points ‘plable’ , ‘grid’ , ‘group’,’equal’
GetPoint(obj,id,t) Get point data
GetNpts(obj) Get number of points
GetNgpts(obj) Get number of points group
CompressNpts(obj,varargin) Compress repeated points ‘all’
Dist(x,y,obj,varargin) Calculate the closet distance to serval points ‘group’

title: Starts with MATLAB APP
content:
Introduction

MATLAB® apps are interactive applications written to perform technical computing tasks. Apps are included in many MATLAB products. The Apps tab of the MATLAB Toolstrip shows you the apps that you currently have installed.

There are several ways to get more apps: from MATLAB File Exchange, through additional MATLAB products, and by building your own. You can create apps and share them with members of the MATLAB community.

A MATLAB® app is a self-contained MATLAB program with a user interface that automates a task or calculation. All the operations required to complete the task — getting data into the app, performing calculations on the data, and displaying results are performed within the app. Apps are included in many MATLAB products. In addition, you can design your own apps using the App Designer development environment. The Apps tab on the MATLAB Toolstrip displays all currently installed apps when you click the drop-down arrow on the far right of the toolstrip.

Install MATLAB APP

A MATLAB® app installer file, .mlappinstall, is an archive file for sharing an app you created using MATLAB. A single app installer file contains everything necessary to install and run an app: the source code, supporting data, information (such as product dependencies), and the app icon.

An .mlappinstall file is a compressed package that conforms to the Open Packaging Conventions (OPC) interoperability standard. You can search for and install .mlappinstall files using your operating system file browser. When you select an .mlappinstall file in Windows® Explorer or Quick Look (Mac OS), the browser displays properties for the file, such as Authors and Release. Use these properties to search for .mlappinstall files. Use the Tags property to add custom searchable text to the file.

Tools List

Name Description
MergePDF Merge serval pdf files into one document

Reference

[1] https://www.mathworks.com

title: Surface2D
content:
Introduction

Surface2D is an object responsible for importing and creating 2D surfaces.

Examples

Create Surface form Line2D

AddHole

You can add holes at the surface.

Cheat Sheet

Name Description Options
Surface2D(Line2D,varargin) Creat Surface2D object ‘Echo’
GetNface(obj) Get the number of the faces
AddHole(obj,Line2D) Add hole to the surface
Plot(obj,varargin) Plot surfaces ‘face’, ‘axe’, ‘equal’, ‘grid’,’color’

title: Line2D
content:
Introduction

Line2D is an object responsible for importing and creating 2D lines.

Examples

AddLine

AddLine

Add straight line, the straight line only have two points: start point and end point.

AddCurve

AddCircle

Add circle to Line2D, you can also use ‘sang’ and ‘ang’ to define the degree of the curve.

AddEllipse

Add elliptic arc

AddSpline

Add cubic spline curve.

AddBezier

Add Bezier curve.

AddBspline

Add B-spline curve

AddHyperbola

Add hyperbola curve.

AddParabola

Add parabola curve.

Calculate the boundary of several points

Generate random points

Calculate the points boundary

‘Scale’ is a shrink factor. Default value is 0.5. When the factor is 1, the result create a more compact boundary enveloping the points.

We can easily see the different at space.

Draw arrows

You can add arrow head with different types.

'Arrow'=1 'Arrow'=2 'Arrow'=3

Cheat Sheet

Name Description Options
Line2D(‘Name’) Create Line2D object ‘Echo’, ‘Gtol’, ‘Dtol’, ‘Atol’, ‘Rtol’, ‘Adfac’, ‘Compress’, ‘Arrow’, ‘Form’
AddLine(obj,Point2D,P) Add line to Line2D
AddCurve(obj,Point2D,P) Add curve to Line2D
AddBezier( obj, Point2D, P ) Add Bezier curve to Line2D
AddBspline( obj, c, Point2D, P ) Add B-spline curve to Line2D
AddCircle(obj,r,Point2D,P,varargin) Add circle curve to Line2D ‘sang’, ‘ang’, ‘seg’
AddEllipse( obj, a, b,Point2D,P, varargin) Add ellipse curve to Line2D ‘sang’, ‘ang’, ‘seg’, ‘rot’
AddHyperbola( obj, a, b,Point2D,P, varargin ) Add hyperbola to Line2D ‘rot’, ‘t1’, ‘t2’
AddParabola( obj,f,Point2D,P,varargin ) Add parabola to Line2D ‘rot’, ‘t1’, ‘t2’
Boundary(obj,Point2D,varargin) Calculate the boundary of points ‘scale’, ‘group’
GetCurve(obj,id) Get curve data
GetNcrv(obj) Get the number of curve
Plot Plot lines ‘grid’, ‘name’, ‘axe’, ‘clabel’, ‘styles’, ‘equal’, ‘curve’, ‘map’, ‘color’

Reference

[1] https://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/fileexchange/71745-draw19

[2] https://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/fileexchange/72573-fem19?s_tid=srchtitle

title: Mesh
content:
Introduction

Mesh is an object responsible for importing and creating single 3D Meshes.

Examples

Meshcube

You can define the section position and vector to see the section view of elements.

MeshCylinder

MeshSphere

TetGen

I use TetGen to generate tetrahedralization mesh.

For a set of 3d (weighted) points, TetGen generates the Delaunay and weighted Delaunay tetrahedralization as well as their duals, the Voronoi diagram and power diagram. The flowchart of the mesh generation process of TetGen is shown below.

Mesh quality

The quality tetrahedral meshes of a PLC generated by the commands: -pq2/0, -pq1.4/0, and -pq1.1/0

Cheat Sheet

Name Description Options
Mesh('Name') Create Mesh object 'Echo'
MeshCube(obj,Dimensions, ElementNumbers, outputStructType, varargin) Create Cube Mesh 'ElementType'
MeshCylinder(obj,opt) Create Cylinder Mesh
MeshSphere(obj,n,r,varargin) Create Sphere Mesh

Reference

[1] https://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/fileexchange/48208-gibboncode-gibbon?s_tid=srchtitle

[2] https://wias-berlin.de/software/tetgen/

title: Mesh2D
content:
Introduction

Mesh2D is an object responsible for importing and creating 2D Meshes.

Examples

Create gear

Meshquadcircle


Using SmoothFace to get smooth boundary.

Meshquadplate

Cheat Sheet

Name Description Options
Mesh2D(‘Name’) Create Mesh2D object ‘Echo’
AddSurface(obj,Surface2D) Add surface to Mesh2D object
Mesh(obj) Create the mesh for the surface
MeshQuadCircle(obj,varargin) Create quad circle ‘n’, ‘r’, ‘f’
SetSize(obj,edgesize) Set edge size
WriteSTL(obj) Output .STL file

Reference

[2] https://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/fileexchange/48208-gibboncode-gibbon?s_tid=srchtitle

title: Plot test
content:
Introduction

For figure plot, I find a very good open source toolbox Gramm on MATLAB.

Gramm is a powerful plotting toolbox which allows to quickly create complex, publication-quality figures in MATLAB, and is inspired by R’s ggplot2 library. As a reference to this inspiration, Gramm stands for GRAMmar of graphics for MATLAB.

USE CASES AND EXAMPLE SCREENSHOTS ON THE GITHUB README:

Gramm

I integrate Gramm to my plot object Rplot, and I also add many other features and functions to it.

Other plot

Radar plot

With Rplot, we can plot radar figure. Using function set_axe_options to set the zero location.

We can also draw radar figure with other type plot.

Other colormap

Gramm shows a figure with different colormaps:

I also add many other colormaps.(All the colormaps are from here: othercolor)

‘othermap’ does not support the lightness




Drawing annotation options

I add drawing annotation options to Rplot. Add labels to points and lines.

Reference

[1] Morel, (2018). Gramm: grammar of graphics plotting in MATLAB. Journal of Open Source Software, 3(23), 568,

https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.00568

[2] Joshua Atkins (2023). othercolor (https://www.mathworks.com/matlabcentral/fileexchange/30564-othercolor), MATLAB Central File Exchange. Retrieved September 4, 2023.
